description: This table represents an audit trail system for tracking user authentication and authorization activities within the application. The table serves as a logging mechanism to record security-related events and user actions for compliance and monitoring purposes. Currently unpopulated, it appears to function as a standalone auditing entity with no direct foreign key relationships to other tables in the system.

columns.name: instance_id
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. This appears to reference a specific instance or deployment environment where the audited authentication event occurred.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each audit log entry that tracks authentication and authorization events within the system. Serves as the primary key to distinguish individual audit records.

columns.name: payload
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. Contains structured data related to audit log entries but specific content and format cannot be determined without sample values.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Records the exact date and time when each audit log entry was generated, enabling chronological tracking of authentication and authorization events within the system.

columns.name: ip_address
columns.description: Stores the network address from which a user or system initiated an action that triggered an audit log entry. Used for security monitoring and tracking the origin of authentication-related activities.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX audit_log_entries_pkey ON auth.audit_log_entries USING btree (id)
CREATE INDEX audit_logs_instance_id_idx ON auth.audit_log_entries USING btree (instance_id)
